abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment (EA)
            report ensures that environmental impacts, as a result of
            project implementation, are in line with the National
            environmental regulations, and in accordance with Bank
            guidelines. The project is not expected to produce
            detrimental environmental impacts in the surrounding areas,
            nor does any component pose an environmental risk.
            Processing plants have limited potential for local water,
            air, and noise pollution, however, procurement
            specifications would include full environmental protection
            measures to contain pollution within national standards.
            Nonetheless, the study reviews environmental aspects in
            compliance with Chinese standards. Combined waste-water
            effluents of processing plants and public buildings, will be
            either discharged to municipal sewers, or, into septic
            tanks, and solid waste disposed on agricultural land.
            Adequate design of boilers, and processing systems, would
            contain air emissions, while procured equipment is in line
            with required noise emission standards. Similarly, all
            chemicals and fertilizers, would be approved by the Bank, in
            accordance with national standards. A social assessment
            summary is included, indicating the project is unlikely to
            cause social, or cultural conflicts among its population,
            and ethnic groups. Economic, political, and social benefits
            are analyzed, in particular, women's constructive force
            in the project area.
